architectural_notes: Product IDs must use a single consistent type across frontend/backend (string vs number vs BigInt) to avoid fetch/update mismatches.
known_issues: After adding any product, the UI shows 'unable to load the product' due to product ID type mismatch between addProduct response (number) and frontend expectations (string/BigInt conversions).

existing_features.title: Fix the product ID type mismatch that causes the UI to show an error (e.g., "unable to load the product") after adding any product by normalizing backend product IDs and pricePaise values to the UI’s expected types (UI Product.id must always be a string), even when the agent/runtime provides Nat values as JavaScript numbers instead of bigint.

Update the products CRUD hook to ensure all backend calls receive correctly typed arguments derived from UI state: convert UI string IDs to Nat/bigint safely for update/delete operations, and ensure update-product data conversion does not pass an object containing an id field into the UI→backend mapping helper.

projectName: Fix product load failure after adding products (ID type mismatch)
